seg-source.mrk: Network client driver examples

target.mrk: Network client driver examples

trans-unit.source: The following examples specify the user and password URL attributes.

seg-source.mrk: The following examples specify the user and password URL attributes.

target.mrk: The following examples specify the user and password URL attributes.

trans-unit.source: To enable user authentication, you must either use NATIVE authentication or explicitly set the property <codeph>derby.connection.requireAuthentication</codeph> to <codeph>true</codeph>. Otherwise, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not require a user name and password. For details on how to enable user authentication, see "Working with user authentication" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"/>.

seg-source.mrk: To enable user authentication, you must either use NATIVE authentication or explicitly set the property <codeph>derby.connection.requireAuthentication</codeph> to <codeph>true</codeph>.
Otherwise, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not require a user name and password.
For details on how to enable user authentication, see "Working with user authentication" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"/>.

target.mrk: To enable user authentication, you must either use NATIVE authentication or explicitly set the property <codeph>derby.connection.requireAuthentication</codeph> to <codeph>true</codeph>.
Otherwise, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not require a user name and password.
For details on how to enable user authentication, see "Working with user authentication" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"/>.

trans-unit.source: For a multi-user product, you would typically specify authentication for the system in the <codeph>derby.properties</codeph> file for your server, since it is in a trusted environment. The following property setting specifies NATIVE authentication:

seg-source.mrk: For a multi-user product, you would typically specify authentication for the system in the <codeph>derby.properties</codeph> file for your server, since it is in a trusted environment.
The following property setting specifies NATIVE authentication:

target.mrk: For a multi-user product, you would typically specify authentication for the system in the <codeph>derby.properties</codeph> file for your server, since it is in a trusted environment.
The following property setting specifies NATIVE authentication:

seg-source.mrk: derby.authentication.provider=NATIVE:myCredentialsDB:LOCAL

target.mrk: derby.authentication.provider=NATIVE:myCredentialsDB:LOCAL

trans-unit.source: It is strongly recommended that production systems rely on NATIVE authentication, an external directory service such as LDAP, or a user-defined class for authentication. It is also strongly recommended that production systems protect network connections with SSL/TLS.

seg-source.mrk: It is strongly recommended that production systems rely on NATIVE authentication, an external directory service such as LDAP, or a user-defined class for authentication.
It is also strongly recommended that production systems protect network connections with SSL/TLS.

target.mrk: It is strongly recommended that production systems rely on NATIVE authentication, an external directory service such as LDAP, or a user-defined class for authentication.
It is also strongly recommended that production systems protect network connections with SSL/TLS.

seg-source.mrk: Example 1

target.mrk: Example 1

trans-unit.source: The following example connects to the default server name localhost on the default port, 1527, and to the database sample.

seg-source.mrk: The following example connects to the default server name localhost on the default port, 1527, and to the database sample.

target.mrk: The following example connects to the default server name localhost on the default port, 1527, and to the database sample.

seg-source.mrk: jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/sample;user=judy;password=no12see

target.mrk: jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/sample;user=judy;password=no12see

seg-source.mrk: Example 2

target.mrk: Example 2

trans-unit.source: The following example specifies both <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> and Network Client driver attributes:

seg-source.mrk: The following example specifies both <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> and Network Client driver attributes:

target.mrk: The following example specifies both <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> and Network Client driver attributes:

seg-source.mrk: jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/sample;create=true;user=judy;password=no12see

target.mrk: jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/sample;create=true;user=judy;password=no12see

seg-source.mrk: Example 3

target.mrk: Example 3

trans-unit.source: This example connects to the default server name <codeph>localhost</codeph> on the default port, 1527, and includes the path in the database name portion of the URL.

seg-source.mrk: This example connects to the default server name <codeph>localhost</codeph> on the default port, 1527, and includes the path in the database name portion of the URL.

target.mrk: This example connects to the default server name <codeph>localhost</codeph> on the default port, 1527, and includes the path in the database name portion of the URL.

seg-source.mrk: jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/c:/my-db-dir/my-db-name;user=judy; password=no12see

target.mrk: jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/c:/my-db-dir/my-db-name;user=judy; password=no12see

trans-unit.source: For a programming example that shows how to connect to the server using NATIVE authentication, see "NATIVE authentication and SQL authorization example" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"/>.

seg-source.mrk: For a programming example that shows how to connect to the server using NATIVE authentication, see "NATIVE authentication and SQL authorization example" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"/>.

target.mrk: For a programming example that shows how to connect to the server using NATIVE authentication, see "NATIVE authentication and SQL authorization example" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"/>.
